skill.name: docs-write
skill.description: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when creating or editing documentation files (markdown, MDX, etc.).
skill.summary: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when cre...

security_audit.summary: No suspicious file access, network activity, or execution patterns were found. The skill provides writing guidance and formatting conventions only.

content.value_statement: Documentation can be unclear and slow to use. This skill guides you to write concise, user-focused docs with consistent structure.
actual_capabilities: Explains how to frame docs for the audience and their needs
Provides drafting and editing steps for clarity
Defines heading, link, and instruction patterns
Lists wording choices to match Metabase style
Recommends running Prettier with a specific command
limitations: Does not run formatting commands automatically
Does not validate external links or examples in your environment
Relies on provided context and files only

use_cases.title: Standardize new docs
use_cases.description: Create new Markdown documentation that matches Metabase tone and structure.

use_cases.title: Refine feature docs
use_cases.description: Improve clarity and action-first flow in existing documentation.

use_cases.title: Reduce confusion
use_cases.description: Rewrite steps so users find answers quickly and avoid unclear phrasing.

prompt_templates.title: Rewrite a section
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a rough draft paragraph
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this section to match the Metabase documentation style. Keep it short and action-first: <paste text>

prompt_templates.title: Create steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft step-by-step instructions for <task>. Use headings that state the point and include code blocks.

prompt_templates.title: Improve headings
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest better headings for these sections that state the point clearly: <list headings>

prompt_templates.title: Full doc edit
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit this Markdown document for Metabase style. Focus on clarity, concise wording, and proper links: <paste doc>

output_examples.input: Rewrite this setup guide for clarity and Metabase tone.
output: Use action-first headings and short steps
Explain the why after the action
Replace vague words with simple terms

best_practices: Lead with the action, then explain the reason
Use descriptive links and precise headings
Keep each paragraph focused on one purpose
anti_patterns: Burying key actions inside long paragraphs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Markdown and MDX files?
faq.answer: Yes. It is designed for documentation text such as Markdown and MDX.

faq.question: Does it format files automatically?
faq.answer: No. It recommends running Prettier but does not execute commands.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing docs workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Use it as a writing and editing guide within your process.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It does not request credentials or external data.

faq.question: What if the guidance conflicts with my style guide?
faq.answer: Prefer your project style guide and use this as supplemental advice.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on Metabase tone, structure, and common documentation patterns.
